content: Congress passed the FY2018 Consolidated Appropriations Act on March 23, 2018 (H.R. 1625), which included Agriculture appropriations bills from both the House and Senate Committees. The House had also passed a consolidated bill (H.R. 3354) that included agriculture. The final appropriation was facilitated by new budget caps in the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018 (P.L. 115-123). The Agriculture appropriations bill, facilitated by new budget caps in the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018, passed through the House and Senate Committees.
